text: Winter Gardens Great Yarmouth Winter Gardens is a grade II* listed building in Great Yarmouth, England. It was built of glass and iron in Torquay and moved to Great Yarmouth in 1904.Victorian Society reveals top 10 buildings 'crying out' to be saved. BBC News, 12 September 2018. Retrieved 13 September 2018. In 2018, it was named among the top ten endangered buildings of the Victorian and Edwardian eras in a survey released by the Victorian Society.Great Yarmouth Winter Gardens among UK's most at-risk buildings. Mark Brown, The Guardian, 12 September 2018. Retrieved 13 September 2018. ==See also== * Grade II* listed buildings in Great Yarmouth ==References== ==External links== Category:Grade II* listed buildings in Norfolk Category:Great Yarmouth
title: Winter Gardens, Great Yarmouth
